Explanation:
The paragraph mentions "the levels of serum creatinine and blood urea after cisplatin administration". Both serum creatinine and blood urea are chemicals (specifically, they are waste products) that can be measured in body fluids. Cisplatin is also a chemical, as it is a medication. Therefore, all three entities are valid chemical entities in this context.
